data.message: Channel 13 news was just talking about this change in Facebook's privacy policy. Better safe than sorry. As of January 4th, 2015 at 10:17 pm eastern standard time. I do not give Facebook permission or any entities associated with Facebook permission to use my pictures, information, or posts, both past and future. By this statement I give notice to Facebook it is strictly forbidden to disclose, copy, distribute it take any other action against be based on this profile is private and confidential information. The violation if privacy can be punished by law (ucc 1-308-11 308-103 and Rome statute). NOTE: Facebook is now a public entity. All members must post a note like this. If you prefer, you can copy and paste this version. If you duo not publish this statement at least once it will be tactically allowing the use of your photos ,as well as information contained in the profile status updates. DO NOT SHARE you MUST copy and paste to make this I will leave a comment so it will be easier to copy and paste!!!

replies.message: Hey Lizzy. Thanks for checking in with us. This campaign is a known hoax. If you see content like this on Facebook, please report it to us as spam by using these tips from our Help Center: https://www.facebook.com/help/205730929485170. -Sarah
